masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Verification Instructions

Verify that the SAML token has been signed with a valid trusted signature. Attempt to modify assertion content to see if the application validates that the SAML token matches the signature.

Attempt to add additional assertions to the SAML token.

Use Burp SAML Raider to:
  • remove signatures

  • resign messages with cloned and self-signed signatures

  • Use XSW attacks to attempt to circumvent signature checking


Reporting Requirements
  1. Add detailed explanation / screenshots explaining what is weak about signature validation

  2. Show unauthorized / escalated access to the application


References:
  • http://www.ws-attacks.org/
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Ensure that SAML messages are signed by a trusted party to ensure SAML assertions have not been modified. If assertion-level signatures are used, ensure that each assertion requires a valid signature.
masterFinding.name: SAML - Weak Signature Validation
masterFinding.businessImpact: Weak SAML signature verification may allow malicious users to tamper with SAML token content. This may result in unauthorized access or elevated privileges in the application that uses SAML for authentication.
masterFinding.description: The application does not perform adequate validation of the SAML signatures to prevent SAML token tampering.
